titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-547, by Mr. McInnis.

Resolution waives clause 4(b) of rule XI (requiring a two-thirds vote to consider a rule on the same day it is reported from the Committee on Rules Committee) against certain resolutions reported from the Rules Committee

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 195.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/22/1998--Introduced. Waives provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported by such Committee before May 22, 1998, to provide for the consideration or disposition of H.R. 2400 (funding for highway and transportation programs) including any amendment, conference report, or any amendment from conference in disagreement thereon.
